ISSUE.TITLE: droned and 'app' box
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: Is it possible to tell `droned` where to find the Angular assets manually? For example, I'm building a custom Dockerfile. I copy `droned` inside but when I run it I get error `panic: could not locate box "app"`. To get around that I can embed the assets to the binary as per the `rice` [doco](https://github.com/GeertJohan/go.rice/blob/master/README.md): ``` sh $ cd server $ go build -o droned $ rice append --exec droned ``` Using that binary inside my container works. I'd prefer not to have to append the assets in that way. It would be better if I could simply tell droned where to find these assets at startup e.g. via command line flag.
